options.text: mass of crew, their baggage, plus removable units of equipment.
mass of all persons and items of load, including fuel and other consumable fluids.
mass of passengers, crew and their baggage, plus removable equipment and consumable fuel and fluids.
mass of all passengers, crew and their baggage, less fuel and consumable fluids.

variant.question: A load placed forward of the datum:

options.text: has a negative arm and therefore generates a negative moment.
has a positive arm and therefore generates a positive mass and moment.
has a negative arm and therefore generates a negative mass and moment.
has a positive arm and therefore generates a positive moment.

variant.question: A load placed forward of the datum:

options.text: Has a negative arm and therefore generates a negative moment
Has a positive arm and therefore generates a positive mass and moment
Has a negative arm and therefore generates a negative mass and moment
Has a positive arm and therefore generates a positive moment

variant.question: The datum used for balance calculations is

options.text: chosen on the longitudinal axis of the aeroplane, but not necessarily between the nose and the tail of the aircraft.
chosen on the longitudinal axis of the aircraft and necessarily situated between the leading edge and trailing edge of the wing.
chosen on the longitudinal axis of the aircraft, and always at the firewall level.
chosen on the longitudinal axis of the aeroplane, and necessarily situated between the nose and the tail of the aircraft.

variant.question: Refer to Annex, weighing schedule.  Calculate the Basic Empty Mass and the Centre of Gravity.

options.text: 968.4 kg and 179.7 cm
9500 kg and 179.7 cm
9500 kg and 1 707 000 N.cm

variant.question: The method of using indexes in mass and balance calculations is used to:

options.text: decrease the magnitude of the moments.
increase the magnitude of the useful load.
decrease the magnitude of the useful load.
increase the magnitude of the moments.

variant.question: The index method in mass and balance calculations is used for...

options.text: reducing the value of the moment.

reducing the <span style="display: inline !important; float: none; background-color: #ffffff; color: #000000; font-family: Arial,Sans-serif;  font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;">value of the centre of gravity.

increasing the <span style="display: inline !important; float: none; background-color: #ffffff; color: #000000; font-family: Arial,Sans-serif;  font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;">value of the useful load.

increasing the <span style="display: inline !important; float: none; background-color: #ffffff; color: #000000; font-family: Arial,Sans-serif;  font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: none; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;">value of the moment.

variant.question: In mass and balance calculations the "index" is:

options.text: is a figure without unit of measurement which represents a moment.
a location in the aeroplane identified by a number.
the range of moments the centre of gravity (CG) can have without making the aeroplane unsafe to fly.
an imaginary vertical plane or line from which all measurements are taken.

variant.question: The index method in mass and balance calculations is used for..

options.text: reducing the magnitude of the moment.
reducing the magnitude of the centre of gravity.
increasing the magnitude of the moment.
increasing the magnitude of the useful load.

variant.question: Usually in mass and balance calculations an index is used. The loaded index is:

options.text: a value of moment which is simplified and scaled down.
used in fuel density calculations and is called fuel-loading index.
used for ground handling purposes and is called wing-loading index.
called floor-loading index and it is used to simplify the loading of an aircraft.
